We get together and our eyes meet
We talk and find that we are similar to each other
We feel something whose details we do not understand
And the most beautiful moment of the story is its beginning
And after a while we become bolder and do it,
We open our hearts to each other
And we talk to each other honestly and our feelings become love
And in seconds we live as two people with one heart
We live a story sweeter than we can ever imagine
And our love starts to get bigger and to evolve
And after a while our feelings change
And suddenly easy things become difficult
We fight and every truth becomes apparent
And we blame each other, a tasteless and colorless blame
Life takes us away from our passions towards wounds
And we get away for a bit and our souls become separated
We feel then that the separation set us at ease
And we get used to it and stop caring
Our hearts' fate in love
is one similar story
but the ending is different
Love is a journey
And with it our life becomes sweet
It is our fate and not a cooincidence
We pass by each other, our eyes accidentally meet.
And once we start to talk we find out the we are alike.
We feel something general without realizing the small details.
The very first moment in every story is always the most beautiful.
Then we dare to do it,
To open our hearts.
Being frank, this feeling turns out to be love.
For a moments we become a two with one heart.
We live a story that is more beautiful than we would imagine,
our love start to grow and move ahead,
and in a while it start to change over.
and what was once easy suddenly turns out to be hard.
We start to quarrel, every truth starts to reveal.
We blame each other with a pale blame.
Being driven out of passion into wounds.
We step back a little bit, our souls begin to separate.
We feel then that the break up is settling us down.
We get used to this and we stop caring1.
Our hearts share in love
is always the very same story,
Only finale that differs.
Love is actually a journey.
With it our lives become sweeter.
Our destiny can never be a coincidence.

Absent-minded she saw memories of best days in her life.
